Questions.Text:
As a business student, you want to better
understand the theory and history of supply chain management before you examine
a particular topic in more detail. You’re looking for a factual and in-depth
information, and you want it presented in a format that is organized and
informative.

As a public relations student, you are required
to write a case study that analyses how a major public figure has handled a
controversy. You’ve identified a suitable public figure to study and now you
need see how the controversy was addressed by this public figure and how it was
subsequently received and discussed by the public. This controversy occurred
recently, and it unfolded over several weeks.

As an Engineering and IT student, you are
preparing a project proposal for your third-year capstone project. You want to
prove that the project you are proposing is going to fill a need in the market,
so you want to learn more about similar products currently available in the
market, how these products have been received by the public, how similar
companies or projects succeeded or failed and other insights into your topic
that are both informed but not too specific.

As a nursing student, you are learning about
best practices to reduce “patient-to-professional” disease transmission, and
you want to find discussions of specific and recent examples of disease
outbreaks where these best practices have been used. The information you are
looking for needs to be evidence-based and authoritative, and the discussion
needs to be informed by an expert medical perspective.

As a trades and apprenticeship student, you have
been asked to write a proposal to a hypothetical client, outlining the various
materials they might choose for their new roof and recommending the material
that best suits their various needs and circumstances. You want to better
understand what working professionals in your field are saying about roofing
materials currently available to them, so that your proposal will be current
and accurate.

As
a health sciences student, you have been asked to explore the social
determinants of health in Canada. To help you find possible connections between
health outcomes and social factors like education and income, you are looking
for reliable statistical information about the Canadian population.

As
a business student, you have been asked to write a corporate profile of a
successful Canadian retailer. You have selected the company that you intend to
profile, and now you need to find out more about them: e.g. the products and
services they offer, their mission statement, their history, etc.

As
a student in the Early Childhood Education program, you have been asked to
write a report on the real-life experiences of professionals working in the
field. In addition to information that you have already gathered from articles
published in trade publications and industry-specific magazines, you want to
hear directly from working ECE’s: their unfiltered observations and reflections
on current issues in the field.

As
a continuing education student taking COMM1085 online, you are preparing to
complete the Language Lab Assignment on Subjects and Verbs.  You decide you would like to conduct some additional
practice and review, so you are looking for a reliable set of online grammar
quizzes that will also provide you with the correct answers and detailed
explanations.

Jimmy Wales, one of Wikipedia’s founders, has publicly stated that
post-secondary students should not cite Wikipedia on their assignments.

Answer.FeedbackText: The correct answer is true. Find out why Wikipedia is not a good resource for serious research: Wikipedia Founder Discourages Academic Use of His Creation.

Questions.Text:
Wikipedia’s editorial policy restricts contributors from citing other
Wikipedia articles in their articles

Answer.FeedbackText: The correct answer is true. Find out why Wikipedia discourages citing Wikipedia: Wikipedia: Citing Wikipedia.

Questions.Text:
Articles on Wikipedia are subject to revision at any time, so the
information you cite on your paper may be changed or removed after you submit
your work.

Wikipedia has similar
expectations for the quality of sources used in their articles, defining a
credible source much the same way as your professor might: “reliable,
third-party, published sources with a reputation for fact-checking and
accuracy.”

Answer.FeedbackText: The correct answer is true. Find out about Wikipedia’s guidelines for reliable sources: Wikipedia: Identifying reliable sources.

Questions.Text:
Wikipedia maintains and publishes a list of all the hoaxes its editors
have found over the years: pages that contain false information that was
intentionally included in the article for the purpose of tricking readers into
believing it was true. The list features more than 100 hoaxes that went
unnoticed and unchanged for 5 years or longer.

Answer.FeedbackText: The correct answer is true. To see how many hoaxes have been reported and the definition of a hoax, read Wikipedia: List of hoaxes on Wikipedia.

Questions.Text:
Wikipedia editors lack diversity, much more so than reputable
publications and academic journals. A study conducted in 2011 found that
approximately 90% of Wikipedia editors are male.

Answer.FeedbackText: To read about how Wikipedia editors are overwhelmingly male, read Wiki-opoly.

Questions.Text:
The majority of
Wikipedia editors live in the United States and Europe, and their perspective
influences the material that is published on the site. For example, according to a
2011 study, only one African county is the subject of more articles than
Antarctica. Even the fictional Middle Earth is featured in more articles than
many African nations.

Answer.FeedbackText: To read about how Wikipedia is biased towards Western topics, read Wiki-opoly.
